Method Detail

getOrdinalSuffix

public static java.lang.String getOrdinalSuffix(int n)
Get the two-letter suffix that should appear after the specified number. When appended to their corresponding numbers, these suffices produce the following: 0th, 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, and so on. The suffix is completely determined by the rightmost digit of n, except for the cases of 11, 12, 13, all of which have the suffix "th".

Parameters:
n - The number to get the suffix for. Assumed to be positive.
Returns:
The two-letter ordinal suffix.

getDaysInMonth

public static int getDaysInMonth(int year,
                                 int month)
Get the number of days in the specified month during the specified year. Februaries in leap years have 29 days.

Parameters:
year - Year in which month occurs.
month - Month in which to get the number of days. A value of 1 means January, 12 means December.
Returns:
The number of days in the specified month.

isLeap

public static boolean isLeap(int year)
See if the specified year is a leap year or not. A year is a leap year if it's divisible by four -- but not if it is divisible by 100 -- unless it is divisible by 400. So, leap years include 1996 and 2000, but not 1900.

Parameters:
year - Year to check for leapness.
Returns:
True if year is a leap year, false otherwise.
